title: VCS2600
summary: I never owned a VCS, but it was the first video game console I ever saw at a friend's house.

title: MS-DOS
summary: Tried to play games on the IBM XT—not great. All changed once I'd discovered the original (text-based) Tetris.

title: ARCADE
summary: Played some early games while on holiday in Italy. Some later games were fun, although I was never a big fan of arcade games.

title: Amiga
summary: Amazing graphics and brilliant sound. But it crashed a lot and most games weren't all that good. Still very proud when I first got it.

title: NES
summary: Less powerful than the Amiga, yet a much better gaming experience.

title: Gameboy
summary: Nintendo's handheld revolution; gaming on the go changed everything … now I didn't have to be at home to avoid talking to people!

title: SNES
summary: My personal 16-bit golden age; Mode 7 and incredible soundtracks compared to the PC's much more expensive setup.

title: Mac
summary: A few good games, but the Multimedia CDs were unique.

title: N64
summary: First Nintendo console I didn't actually like that much.

title: GBA
summary: A lot better than the original Gameboy with some incredible games.
